page.title: 13 MARKETS IN FOLKESTONE
page.content: Folkestone's markets are held outside in car parks. A large variety of goods is sold off wooden tables and rails. These goods are often cheaper than shop prices. The traders gather at an allocated place on a specified day of the week. The traders often have to pay the org- aniser a sum of money to allow them to take part. Folkestone houses three markets, two in the town centre on Thursdays and Saturdays and a very large one on the sea front on Sundays. Demonstrations, take-away food stalls and auctions are all included in the markets, which are popular with both local people and visitors. All of Folkestone's markets are open from early morning until around four o'clock. Some traders leave before four, while others stay until the end.
